Description: Glazed composition model of the usual type of Early Dynastic pot-stand: narrowing towards the top and having a projecting lip. There are three triangular hollows in the sides near the base, to represent the apertures normally found in pot-stands of this type. The green glaze has decayed to dull white.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Osiris-Khentimentu (Abydos), Chamber M.69 deposit
Curator's comments: See, for example, the pot-stands illustrated in W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' II (London, 1902-4), pl.XII, 270-2. For a glazed model similar to this object, see J. E. Quibell & F. W. Green, 'Hierakonpolis' I (London, 1989), pl.XLVIIIb. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' II (London, 1902-4), pl. VII, 114.
